title: 112_s3054
content: The Act titled "Army Arsenal Strategic Workload Enhancement Act of 2012" allows the Department of Defense to utilize arsenals. The Department of Defense is required to establish guidelines for utilizing US-owned factories or arsenals to produce supplies economically while maintaining readiness for mobilizations and emergencies. The Department of Defense must analyze the direct costs of manufacturing supplies to determine economic feasibility. If no analysis is done, a report must be submitted to Congress. The Department of Defense must analyze the direct costs of manufacturing supplies to determine economic feasibility and submit a report to Congress. SEC. 3 assigns workload at Army factories and arsenals. The Secretary of the Army is required to assign workload at Army factories and arsenals to ensure cost efficiency and technical competence in peacetime, while maintaining readiness for mobilizations and national defense emergencies. Workload includes manufacturing supplies, components, parts, systems, subsystems, and foreign military sales. Guidelines will be developed to make arsenals available for procurement by the Department of Defense, defense agencies, and military services. The Secretary of the Army may waive requirements for national defense purposes, with notification to Congress. An annual report on arsenal manufacturing capabilities and workload must be submitted to Congress. The Secretary of the Army must submit an annual report to Congress on the workload, manufacturing capabilities, and capital investments needed for arsenals. The Comptroller General will review the reports for completeness and compliance, providing findings and recommendations to the congressional defense committees within 60 days. Chapter 433 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by updating the item related to section 4532. The initial workload plan report for the assignment of workload at Army factories and arsenals must be submitted within 180 days of the enactment of the Act.
